adverb.description: In a sober and conventional way.
examples: they've been dressing more conservatively at the office
an upscale living room, conservatively furnished

adverb.description: In a cautious way that seeks to avoid potential risks.
examples: she conservatively estimates a supply shortfall of $8 million this year

adverb.description: In a way that is intended to control symptoms rather than eliminate a condition.
examples: the frostbite injury was treated conservatively
